intro: Agelaea punctulata, commonly known as the spotted agelaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant features palmate leaves with a distinctive spotted pattern on the underside, which gives it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Agelaea punctulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and showy blooms.
